newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Koor sells stake in Sefen.
newsitem.headline: Koor sells stake in Sefen.

text.p: Koor Industries Ltd said it has signed an agreement to sell its 66 percent stake in Sefen Ltd to another Israeli company called Etz Lavud Ltd for $12 million.
Both Sefen and Etz Lavud are makers of formica and plywood.
The price paid for Sefen values the entire company at $18 million, about double its current market value of $9.2 million.
The sale is subject to approval from the anti-trust authority.

Koor said the sale was part of its strategy of concentrating on its core businesses -- infrastructure, telecommunications, chemicals and tourism -- and divesting itself of holdings outside these sectors.

Sefen employs 260 workers and has annual sales of $45 million, mostly exports. Plagued by losses, Sefen underwent a recovery programme and its return to profitability enabled its sale at an above-market price, Koor said.
The recovery programme also paved the way for an initial public offering of Sefen shares in Tel Aviv in 1992.
Koor, Israel's largest industrial holding concern, is also listed in New York.
